thread.title: Iowa Wesleyan football falls in road matchup with to Saint Scholastica
thread.title_full: Iowa Wesleyan football falls in road matchup with to Saint Scholastica

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Iowa Wesleyan football falls in road matchup with to Saint Scholastica
text:
Iowa Wesleyan football falls in road matchup with to Saint Scholastica Oct 12, 2015 
DULUTH Minn. — Iowa Wesleyan played at College of Saint Scholastica for Saturday’s Upper Midwest Athletic Conference contest. The Tigers were on the road for a second straight game and faced a Saints team that is currently in first place in UMAC standings. 
IW lost their sixth straight game, falling to Saint Scholastica by a score of 41-7. The Tigers lone score came late in the fourth quarter when Alex Payne connected with Tylor Hoyle for an 8 yard touchdown reception. 
Saint Scholastica scored twice in the opening period, once on a field goal attempt and the second on a 25 yard touchdown pass. The Saints extended their lead in the second quarter after scoring four touchdowns. They would add one more touchdown in the third quarter to take a 41-0 lead into the final period. 
Iowa Wesleyan scored with 3:16 remaining in the game. The Tigers drive lasted 1:57 on five plays that went for a total of 23 yards. Alex Payne found Tylor Hoyle in the endzone for an 8 yard reception. Nick Fencl’s extra point attempt was good to bring the score to 41-7. 
The Tigers won the battle on the ground, rushing for 127 yards. The Saints had the upper hand in through the air, however, throwing for 206 yards on 13-31 attempts. 
Iowa Wesleyan’s ground game was led by Bryson Oliver. Oliver had 11 carries for 37 yards. Nick Fencl had four carries for 34 yards for the Tigers. Through the air, IW’s leading receiver was Oliver with three catches for 16 yards. Alex Payne was 4-17 with two interceptions and a touchdown on the day. Caleb Huss was 4-5 with an interception before leaving the game with an injury. 
Defensively, the Tigers were led by Eric Dubose. Dubose had 8 tackles, two for a loss, and a forced fumble against the Saints. Avery Sylvester ended the day with seven tackles, four solo and three assisted. Donte McClendon had an interception for the Tigers. 
Iowa Wesleyan’s next game will be Saturday, Oct. 17. The Tigers will host Eureka College at 1 p.m.
